definition: lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
variant of 針|针[zhen1], needle

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
variant of 線|线[xian4]

sentences.english: Her sight is equal to threading a needle without glasses.
sentences.chinese: 她的视力很好，能不戴眼镜穿针引线。

sentences.english: The Science and Technology Association served the function of a go-between.
sentences.chinese: 科学技术协会发挥了穿针引线的作用。

sentences.english: Threading ga needle is an art in itself.
sentences.chinese: 穿针引线本身就是一种技巧。

sentences.english: Diane's role was to introduce the piece.
sentences.chinese: 黛安充当的是穿针引线的角色。

sentences.english: She frowns when she's putting thread into a needle.
sentences.chinese: 她穿针引线时，总是眯眼蹙额。

sentences.english: Threading a needle is an art in itself .
sentences.chinese: 穿针引线本身就是一种技巧。

sentences.english: This afternoon, sunshine in my tranquil emptiness threads.
sentences.chinese: 这个下午，阳光在我安静的空空荡荡中，穿针引线。

sentences.english: My grandmother can't easily thread the needle.
sentences.chinese: 穿针引线对我祖母来说可不容易。

definition: thread a needle
flying needle and running seam (idiom); skillful needlework
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to help/to assist financially
woven cloth/to weave cloth
to back sb up/to support sb in an argument/(lit. to beat nearby drum)
to weave/to knit/to plait/to braid/(fig.) to create (sth abstract, e.g. a dream, a lie etc)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
capable/clever/dexterous
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to embroider/to do embroidery
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
